meanings.definition: Exchange of goods or services for money
meanings.sent1: The selling of fruits at the market was brisk.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the selling of handmade crafts online.
meanings.sent3: The selling of ice cream in winter seemed odd.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the selling of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker announcement made the selling of tickets clear.

meanings.sent1: She was skilled at selling products to customers.
meanings.sent2: The salesman was busy selling his latest gadgets.
meanings.sent3: He tried selling the idea of a snowball fight in summer.
meanings.sent4: His words were like selling dreams to the weary.
meanings.sent5: The magician was selling illusions to the audience.

meanings.sent1: The colorful display caught my eye in the selling area.
meanings.sent2: The online selling of books made it convenient for readers.
meanings.sent3: The selling of hot chocolate on a hot day was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer's voice was like the selling of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The sign outside was selling the promise of a delicious meal.
